title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a file is already open in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor does nothing. There should be a warning message displayed by the workbench informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be shown indicating that all files need to be closed before opening this file. This behavior is believed to be a safety feature in WSAD, preventing external editing while a file is already open in WSAD.
EB: When a file is already open in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor should display a warning message in the workbench, cautioning about potential changes being overwritten and prompting the user to confirm their action. Alternatively, an error message should be shown indicating that all files must be closed before attempting to open this file.
SR:
1. Close any open files.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the same java file.
5. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
6. Verify that a warning message is displayed, cautioning about potential changes being overwritten and asking the user to confirm their action. If not, verify that an error message is displayed, indicating that all files must be closed first before opening this file.
